Well, despite what the all the anti's and naysayers say about Iraqis not really wanting democracy, it appears they DO want to vote and take it pretty seriously. 
 From the main CNN page: "Iraqis turned out in droves to pick a 275-member parliament today, with the once-reluctant Sunni Arabs streaming to the polls. Turnout was apparently so heavy across the country that election officials kept the polls open for an extra hour to accommodate Iraqis exercising their democratic rights."From the story:"There were early signs Sunni Arab voters were choosing to embrace the political process. The turnout appeared steady and brisk in some Sunni-dominated areas."
 
 A celebratory atmosphere took hold in some locations. In the eastern Ramadi neighborhood of Sufiya, candy was being handed out, as people came to vote. Khalilzad said that people arrived to polls with families "almost like going to a wedding."
 
 http://www.cnn.com/2005/WORLD/meast/12/15/iraq.elections/index.html
 
 Gee, no bombings of voting stations. No sky falling. No end of the Iraqi civilization. What will the anti-war people do now? They've lost a key part of their message about Iraq: that Iraqis really don't want what America is making possible for them.

 The US is threatening Iran with military force...Iraq just signed a mutual defense treaty with them.
